triples.name: Evolutionary game theory
triples.relevance: The paper applies evolutionary game theory framework to study strategy evolution in structured populations with feedback mechanisms.

triples.name: Lattice network
triples.relevance: The paper investigates how lattice network structures influence evolutionary game outcomes and demonstrate their role in promoting cooperation.

triples.name: Prisoner's dilemma
triples.relevance: The prisoner's dilemma is the underlying game structure used to model the cooperation versus defection strategic choices in the study.

triples.name: Population dynamics
triples.relevance: Population dynamics principles govern how strategies spread and evolve through the population across generations in the model.

triples.name: Network topology
triples.relevance: Network topology determines the neighborhood structure that shapes how individuals interact and influence each other's strategy adoption.
